overview: More than three million people in Germany have a part-time job. A new record figure. For many, the earnings from their main job are simply not enough. Mostly women are the losers on the labour market: part-time, mini-jobs, low wages. What future do these women have? For the NDR report, journalist Judith Rakers delves into the life of Tanja Reller from Hamburg, a single mother with multiple jobs.
title: Reportage - Schicksal Armutsfalle
